Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of the CAPAC Platform for Targeted Cancer Therapy

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either the CAPAC treatment (SQ3370) or conventional doxorubicin.

Participants.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted in a preclinical setting using a syngeneic tumor model in mice.

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to receive either the CAPAC treatment (SQ3370) or conventional doxorubicin.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the maximum tolerated dose (MTD) of SQP33, measured over a 38-day period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 40 mice were randomised, with 20 in each group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The MTD of SQP33 was 19.1-times higher than conventional doxorubicin in mice.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were less frequent in the CAPAC group, with no severe events reported.
